text: Dazel Jules (born August 10, 1967) is a Trinidadian former sprinter. Along with Alvin Daniel, Neil de Silva, and Ian Morris, he won a silver medal in the 4 × 400 m relay at the 1993 IAAF World Indoor Championships. In the CARIFTA Games under 20 division, he won silver in the 100 m in 1985, gold in the 100 m in 1986, and silver in the 200 m in 1986. He attended Eastern Michigan University and graduated in 1990. == References == Category:1967 births Category:Living people Category:Trinidad and Tobago male sprinters Category:World Athletics Indoor Championships medalists
title: Dazel Jules
